Address: 1643 S State St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Artisan meat, cheese & sandwich hub with indoor-outdoor seating, house-brewed beers & a retail area.

summary.snippet: "Great meats to take home, really tasty sandwiches and beer for there"
"The price is super reasonable for the high quality food and the quantity of it."
"The curry ketchup was icing on the cake, great place to eat!"

most_relevant.description: It was so beautiful outside, perfect weather to eat! So many options for seating, either shaded or in the sun. Service was impeccable and food came out within a few minutes. A variety of toppings and sauces to put on the side. They also had jars of freshly made pickles, pickled eggs, and other mason jar filled goodies for sale along with some meat products. 10/10 experience! Will be coming back in the future!🌸

Very nice place to eat. Love the outdoor seating area. Well shaded and perfect for a 80 degree Michigan afternoon. Italian sausage was great. Wife had the brat burger but wasn't impressed. She said it was bland. Looked good to me. The loaded tots were delicious too. Wish they had more options for something to drink. Overall thought the place was great but $85 for three people to eat lunch is crazy!

I’m not a beer drinker nor am I a bratwurst eater, BUT this place we ABSOLUTELY will go back to.  The cherry brat was superb! And since they give taste tests, the blond IPA was perfect! What a nice risk for Mother’s Day.   A perfect buzz and a better than perfect taste.

Biercamp has great beer and food. We ordered the chili, Chicago dog, brisket sandwich, and backwoods tots. The brisket was tender the pickles and soft bun really made the sandwich. It was also great to eat outside on a nice day!

Sunny Day Satisfaction at Biercamp

On a bright sunny day, I ventured to Biercamp in Ann Arbor for a delightful lunch takeout experience that still leaves my taste buds reminiscing. Known for their commitment to handmade, locally sourced foods, Biercamp offers a rustic charm that is hard to find elsewhere.

Most Enjoyed Dish: The 12HR Smoked Brisket sandwich was the star of the meal.
Served on a soft, buttery brioche bun, the brisket was incredibly juicy, tender, and packed with flavor, complemented beautifully by the tanginess of pickles and onions, and a delicious BBQ sauce that tied everything together perfectly.

Also Tried:

-Cheddar Hot Dogs: Freshly made in-house and smoked on site, these hot dogs were a treat. Served on a toasted bun, they were a simple pleasure that brought out the child in me.
-Chicken Bratwurst: Also made in-house and served on a toasted bun, the bratwurst was succulent and seasoned to perfection, making for a satisfying bite.

Loved Their Self-Served Topping Bar:
A highlight was their self-served topping bar, which featured a variety of condiments including yellow mustard, dijon, backwoods sweet jalapeno mustard, ketchup, BBQ sauce, onions, sauerkraut, dill relish, and sweet relish. This allowed for a personalized touch to each dish, enhancing the flavors according to my preference.

Other Thoughts:
I'm particularly intrigued by their nitro cold brew, which I plan to try on my next visit. The concept of combining a craft brewery atmosphere with exceptional food quality makes Biercamp a standout.

Final Impressions:
Biercamp is more than just a barbecue spot; it's a testament to the art of in-house meat preparation and smoking, complemented by an impressive selection of craft beers.
Whether you’re dining in their all-season outdoor beer garden or grabbing a quick takeout, their dedication to quality and flavor is evident.
Highly recommended for anyone looking for a genuine, flavorful meal in a casual, friendly setting.

I am from Texas and this is my favorite place to get brisket. They do it right with a delicious sauce and pickles and onions 🤤 My mom really enjoys their pulled pork sandwiches. For us this is a piece of our old home, Texas 😊 We've bought sausage and chorizo and also extremely yummy. I can't wait for the day that I try more of their menu but it's tough not to get their brisket. We saw pastrami and Reuben sandwiches on their menu. I'm already looking forward to my next visit 😋😋😋 BTW, the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Also the extra seating next door is another great addition 👍🏼
Great spot to hangout outside of UM’s busy campus. The the brisket sandwich was fabulous, and great outdoor area, great for bringing your dog or kids.

Awesome place for some beer, BBQ and brats. The best brat I had was the bacon cheddar, the second best maybe the Hawaiian. Definitely would like to try them all. The curry ketchup was icing on the cake, great place to eat!
